text: - Hi, I'm Matt Bell.

I lead the product
research team at Anthropic.

So over the last year, we've
already seen AI disrupt a range
of industries, and one thing

that we've been
particularly impressed by is

that large enterprises
have moved just as quickly

as small ones to introduce
AI into their products.
We've seen this in three major areas.
First is around cost centers.
Large language models are capable
of processing large mountains of text
that previously required a human,

and can also handle simple
dialogue interactions
with ease and grace.

Secondly, we've seen AI
supercharge existing products,

especially in the productivity
space, allowing them

to bring more intelligence and
ease of use to their users.

Lastly, we've seen large language
models create entirely new

categories of products
that weren't possible
before, where generative AI is able

to harness the proprietary
data of the enterprise in order
to create novel outputs.
Integrating Tropics flawed
with Amazon Bedrock brings app developers
the best of both worlds.
You get the safety

and sophistication of
Anthropics Claude model combined

with the security and
scalability of AWS Bedrock.
